intro: Oenanthe subbipinnata, commonly known as the lesser water dropwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that resemble those of other members of the carrot family. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae group. It thrives in wet or marshy habitats, often found near streams or in damp meadows. Oenanthe subbipinnata is native to Europe and parts of Asia, where it plays a role in wetland ecosystems.
